tool.name: ProfileEditor

param.name: profileType
param.dialogReference: The type of cloud storage solution to create a profile for.

param.name: profileName
param.dialogReference:
Name of the profile that is associated with the cloud storage access credentials.

The profile name is a pointer used by OptimizeRasters to extract the associated keys required to access the desired cloud storage solution.

Profile eidtor is meant to enter new profile names for storage. As a precautionary measure the user has to type in the name of existing profile to edit or delete it.

To Edit an existing name, type it here and enter in the changed details. Pick the option to overwrite the profile name to store the edits.

To Delete an existing profile name, type it here and pick the option from the actions list below.

param.name: accessKey
param.dialogReference:
Enter the Access key ID for the entered profile name.

Refer to your cloud storage solution documentation for more information.

param.name: secretAccessKey
param.dialogReference:
Enter the Secret Access key for the entered profile name.

Refer to your cloud storage solution documentation for more information.

param.name: action
param.dialogReference:
Pick an appropriate action from the Editor Option pull down list.

This is only activated if an existing profile name is found.

tool.summary:
Stores credentials such as Profile Name, Secret ID and Secret Key for use with cloud storage solutions such as Amazon S3 or Microsoft Azure.

For the moment, Amzon S3 is supported.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Stores credentials such as Profile Name, Secret ID and Secret Key for use with cloud storage solutions such as Amazon S3 or Microsoft Azure.

For the moment, Amzon S3 is supported.
